conclusion: Setup and assumptions about the light source, ball, initial velocity, gravity, and air resistance.
Vertical position of the ball as a function of time is derived.
At t = 0, the ball is at the midpoint, so its initial position is y(0) = 0.
Shadow position is determined by the line connecting the light source to the ball.
Distance from the light source to the wall is denoted as d.
Using similar triangles, the shadow's position on the wall is calculated.
Expression for shadow position x_s(t) = 2y(t) is derived.
Velocity of the shadow is the derivative of x_s(t) with respect to time.
Velocity of the ball is calculated as dy(t)/dt = v_0 - gt.
Velocity of the shadow is v_s(t) = 2(v_0 - gt).
Initial velocity of the shadow at t = 0 is v_s(0) = 2v_0.
The initial velocity of the shadow is 2v_0.
